description.content:
Last Updated July 2025

You can use Oracle REST APIs to view and manage data stored in Oracle Supply Chain Management Cloud.

Whether you're experienced with or new to REST, use this guide to find what you need, including:

  • A quick start that walks you through a simple request example.
  • Detailed descriptions for each REST API resource.

item.name: Get all financial orchestration transfer prices

request.name: Get all financial orchestration transfer prices

description.content: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • CurrencyCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the currency of the transfer price calculated for a financial route in a financial orchestration flow.
  • DeliveryId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the shipment.
  • EventDate; string; Date when the ownership change event occurred.
  • EventNumber; string; Number that identifies the ownership change event, such as a receipt number or a shipment number.
  • EventType; string; Type of the ownership change event that triggered the financial orchestration flow.
  • FinancialOrchestrationFlowId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the supply chain financial orchestration flow identified for the source document.
  • FinancialOrchestrationFlowName; string; Name of the supply chain financial orchestration flow identified for the source document.
  • FinancialRouteFromBusinessUnitId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the source business unit.
  • FinancialRouteFromBusinessUnitName; string; Name of the source business unit.
  • FinancialRouteId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the financial route, which defines the buy and sell relationship between two profit center business units.
  • FinancialRouteNumber; integer; Sequence number of the financial route in a financial orchestration flow.
  • FinancialRouteToBusinessUnitId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the destination business unit.
  • FinancialRouteToBusinessUnitName; string; Name of the destination business unit.
  • OrderType; string; Type of source line.
  • OrderTypeCode; string; Abbreviation that identifies the type of source line. Valid values are DROP_SHIP, RETURN_TO_VENDOR, RMA, SALES_ORDER, TRANSFER_ORDER, and TRANSFER_ORDER_RETURN.
  • PriceBasis; string; Value that indicates the method used for calculation of the transfer price. Valid values include CUSTOM_BASED, COST_BASED, FUSION_PRICING, and SOURCE_DOCUMENT_PRICE.
  • PriceDate; string; Date that is used for getting the transfer price for a financial orchestration flow. It is normally the ownership change event date.
  • PrimaryRouteId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the primary route that defines the relationship between the source and destination business units in a financial orchestration flow.
  • PrimaryRouteNumber; integer; Sequence number of the primary route in a financial orchestration flow.
  • Shipment; string; Name of the material shipment.
  • ShipmentLine; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the shipment line.
  • SourceDocumentHeaderId; string; Value that uniquely identifies the source document header, such as the purchase order header identifier or the sales order header identifier.
  • SourceDocumentId; string; Value that uniquely identifies the source document, such as the purchase order line location identifier or the fulfillment line identifier.
  • SourceDocumentLineDetailNumber; string; Number that identifies the source document detail line, such as purchase order schedule or fulfillment line number.
  • SourceDocumentLineId; string; Value that uniquely identifies the source document line, such as the purchase order line identifier or the sales order line identifier.
  • SourceDocumentLineNumber; string; Number that identifies the source document line, such as the purchase order line number or the sales order line number.
  • SourceDocumentNumber; string; Number that identifies the source document, such as the purchase order number or the sales order number.
  • SourceDocumentType; string; Type of the source document of the financial orchestration flow. Valid values include PO, SO and IOT for Purchase Order, Sales Order, and Internal Transfer.
  • SourceEventIdentifier; string; Value that uniquely identifies the ownership change event, such as the receipt line identifier or the shipment line identifier.
  • SourceTransactionId; string; Value that uniquely identifies the order in the source application.
  • SourceTransactionLineId; string; Value that uniquely identifies the source order line in the source application.
  • SourceTransactionLineNumber; string; Number that identifies the order line in the source application.
  • SourceTransactionNumber; string; Number that identifies the order in the source application.
  • SourceTransactionSystem; string; Value that references the order capture application that the source order came from.
  • UOM; string; Unit of measure used for calculating the unit transfer price.
  • UnitTransferPrice; number; Unit transfer price calculated for a financial route in a financial orchestration flow.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format: ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables:

  • PrimaryKey: Find financial orchestration transfer prices according to the financial route identifier.
    Finder Variables:
    • FinancialRouteId; integer; Value that uniquely identifies the financial route, which defines the buy and sell relationship between two profit center business units.
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

response.name: The following table describes the default response for this task.

item.name: Get one financial orchestration transfer price

request.name: Get one financial orchestration transfer price

description.content: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key for the Financial Orchestration Transfer Prices resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Financial Orchestration Transfer Prices. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Financial Orchestration Transfer Prices collection resource in order to navigate to a specific instance of Financial Orchestration Transfer Prices to get the hash key.
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".
